data.title: France : Discreet game of musical chairs ongoing at LVMH's top table
data.meta_description: The current move to refresh the luxury giant's executive committee, notably by bringing more women on board, will continue until 2025. Initiated by Bernard Arnault, the aim is to eventually put in - 6/13/2024
data.text:
Read also

France

Hedi Slimane moves back to Paris

Based in the south of France for the last four years, Celine creative director Hedi Slimane has discreetly returned to central Paris.

Subscribers only Families

Front Row | France, Luxembourg

SFC Conseil, Bernard Arnault's discreet Luxembourg back office

A small Luxembourg firm manages the affairs of the LVMH boss in the Grand Duchy and in Belgium, where the three holding companies that control the Arnault family's stake in the luxury giant are registered.

Subscribers only Families

Spotlight | France

Snap French elections leave Bernard Arnault high and dry

President Emmanuel Macron's surprise move to call French parliamentary elections early has put LVMH's founder and CEO in a very uncomfortable position. The billionaire boss is being explicitly targeted by a newly formed left-wing coalition, and he has very few allies on the far right.

Subscribers only Houses

France

Arnault family sidelines right-hand man Nicolas Bazire on the eve of his trial

LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault's long-standing collaborator Nicolas Bazire is currently being tried on appeal for his role in the illegal funding of former French PM Edouard Balladur's failed 1995 presidential bid. Just before the trial began on 3 June, Bazire quietly stepped down from the board of directors of Arnault's family holding company.

Subscribers only Families

Front Row | France

Pierre-Emmanuel Angeloglou, LVMH's haute couture boss by default

The back-and-forth between Michael Burke and Sidney Toledano at the helm of LVMH Fashion Group has left Angeloglou, the former head of L'Or√©al France, as the only stable boss in the luxury giant's haute couture holding company.

Subscribers only Entourage

France

Jacquemus short a co-pilot and strapped for cash

Since CEO Bastien Daguzan's departure six months ago, Simon Porte Jacquemus has been juggling the brand's creative direction and its operational management, just as the company prepares to open three boutiques abroad amid stagnating growth.

Free access Houses

France

Sidney Toledano, LVMH Fashion's comeback king

Three months after being appointed head of LVMH Fashion Group - the division responsible for all the firm's fashion houses except for Dior and Louis Vuitton - Michael Burke has drastically reduced his management role.

Subscribers only Houses

France

Nicolas Bazire leaves LVMH board, but remains at Bernard Arnault's side

Nicolas Bazire, Bernard Arnault's trusted confidant, has left his seat on the LVMH board to his boss's children. But he continues to work for the luxury giant's CEO on a number of key issues.

Subscribers only Houses
